definition: Xie He (479-502), portrait painter from Qi of Southern dynasties 南齊
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
awe-inspiring/abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)

sentences.english: Sheikh Abdel Maged agrees that the organization has moved far beyond its hierarchical origins.
sentences.chinese: 谢赫同意说，这个组织已经远远超出了它的等级根源。

sentences.english: Two months after his arrest Shaikh was sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 被捕后两个月，谢赫被判处死刑。

sentences.english: That shayk had been buried since five hundred years.
sentences.chinese: 这位谢赫五百年前安葬在那里。

sentences.english: A shaykh once visited a Sufi center, known as a khaniqah.
sentences.chinese: 一次，有个谢赫去拜访一个著名的苏菲道堂。

definition: Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God
Mohammed (c. 570-632), central figure of Islam and prophet of God/also written 穆罕默德
Husain or Hussein (name)/Hussein (c. 626-680), Muslim leader whose martyrdom is commemorated at Ashura/Saddam Hussein al Tikriti (1937-2006), dictator of Iraq 1979-2003
Suleiman (name)/General Michel Suleiman (1948-), Lebanese military man and politician, president of Lebanon 2008-2014
Mahdi or Mehdi (Arabic: Guided one), redeemer of some Islamic prophesy
Anwar (name)/Anwar bin Ibrahim (1947-), Malaysian politician, deputy prime minister 1993-1998, imprisoned 1999-2004 on charges including alleged homosexual acts, subsequently overturned
Moussavi, Mir Hussein (1941-), candidate in Iran's disputed 2009 elections
